org.lsmr.vending.hardware

Class CoinReceptacle

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lsmr.vending.hardware.AbstractHardware<CoinReceptacleListener>
      • org.lsmr.vending.hardware.CoinReceptacle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AbstractCoinAcceptor

    public final class CoinReceptacle
extends AbstractHardware<CoinReceptacleListener>
implements AbstractCoinAcceptor
    A temporary storage device for coins. A coin receptacle can be disabled to prevent more coins from being placed within it. A coin receptacle has a maximum capacity of coins that can be stored within it. A coin receptacle can be connected to specialized channels depending on the denomination of each coin (usually used for storing to coin racks) and another for the coin return.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CoinReceptacle

        public CoinReceptacle(int capacity)
        Creates a coin receptacle with the indicated capacity.
        Parameters:
        capacity - The maximum number of coins that can be stored. Must be positive.
        Throws:
        SimulationException - if the capacity is not a positive integer.

    • Method Detail

      • getCapacity

        public int getCapacity()
        Returns the maximum capacity of this coin receptacle. Causes no events.
        Returns:
        The maximum number of items that this device can store.

      • size

        public int size()
        The current number of coins stored.
        Returns:
        The current count. Will be non-negative.

      • connect

        public void connect(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,CoinChannel> rackChannels,
                    CoinChannel coinReturn,
                    CoinChannel other)
        Connects the output channels for use by this receptacle. Causes no events.
        Parameters:
        rackChannels - One channel is expected for each valid denomination.
        coinReturn - This is used when coins are to be returned to the user.
        other - This is another channel that can be used to discard coins; it can be the same as the coin return channel.

      • load

        public void load(Coin... coins)
          throws SimulationException
        Loads the indicated coins into the receptacle, to simulate direct, physical loading. Causes a "coinsLoaded" event to be announced.
        Parameters:
        coins - A sequence of coins to be added. None can be null.
        Throws:
        SimulationException - If the loading exceeds the capacity of the receptacle.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If any coin is null.

      • unload

        public java.util.List<Coin> unload()
        Unloads coins from the receptacle, to simulate direct, physical unloading. Causes a "coinsUnloaded" event to be announced.
        Returns:
        A list of coins unloaded. None will be null. The list can be empty.

      • acceptCoin

        public void acceptCoin(Coin coin)
                throws CapacityExceededException,
                       DisabledException
        Causes the indicated coin to be added to the receptacle if it has space. A successful addition causes a "coinAdded" event to be announced to its listeners. If a successful addition causes the receptacle to become full, it will also announce a "coinsFull" event to its listeners.
        Specified by:
        acceptCoin in interface AbstractCoinAcceptor
        Parameters:
        coin - The coin to be taken as input.
        Throws:
        CapacityExceededException - if the receptacle has no space.
        DisabledException - if the receptacle is disabled.

      • storeCoins

        public void storeCoins()
                throws CapacityExceededException,
                       DisabledException
        Causes the receptacle to attempt to move its coins to the coin racks. Any coins that either do not fit in the coin racks or for which no coin rack exists are delivered to the "other" channel, which might be another permanent storage receptacle, a coin return, etc. A successful storage will cause a "coinsRemoved" event to be announced to its listeners.
        Throws:
        CapacityExceededException - if one of the output channels fails to accept the coin.
        DisabledException - if the receptacle is disabled.

      • returnCoins

        public void returnCoins()
                 throws CapacityExceededException,
                        DisabledException
        Instructs this coin receptacle to return all of its coins to the user. If any coins are returned, a "coinsReturned" event will be announced to its listeners.
        Throws:
        CapacityExceededException - if the coin return is overfull.
        DisabledException - if the receptacle is disabled.

      • hasSpace

        public boolean hasSpace()
        Returns whether this coin receptacle has enough space to accept at least one more coin. Causes no events.
        Specified by:
        hasSpace in interface AbstractCoinAcceptor
        Returns:
        true if there is space, false if there is not space
